feed.title: The Daily Edition
feed.description: The news you need for your day.

items.title: Top Republican says Trump committed 'impeachable offenses'
items.author: By DARLENE SUPERVILLE, ALAN FRAM and MARY CLARE JALONICK
items.description:
WASHINGTON (AP) — Two Republican senators now say Donald Trump should resign and a third says the president should be “very careful” in his remaining days in office as the House prepares to impeach Trump in the wake of deadly riots at the Capitol.
Pennsylvania Sen. Pat Toomey on Sunday joined Alaska …
items.content:
WASHINGTON (AP) — Two Republican senators now say Donald Trump should resign and a third says the president should be “very careful” in his remaining days in office as the House prepares to impeach Trump in the wake of deadly riots at the Capitol.
Pennsylvania Sen. Pat Toomey on Sunday joined Alaska …

items.title: Capitol attending physician warns lawmakers and staffers of potential Covid-19 exposure following riot
items.author: By Daniella Diaz, Phil Mattingly
items.description: Lawmakers and Capitol staff on Sunday received a memo from the Capitol's attending physician warning of a possible risk of Covid-19 exposure after a large group of lawmakers were forced to gather in a secure location during the breach of the US Capitol last week.
items.content: Lawmakers and Capitol staff on Sunday received a memo from the Capitol's attending physician warning of a possible risk of Covid-19 exposure after a large group of lawmakers were forced to gather in a secure location during the breach of the US Capitol last week.

items.title: Indonesian divers find parts of Boeing plane wreckage in Java Sea
items.author: Morgan Hines
items.description:
Indonesian divers on Sunday located parts of the wreckage of a Boeing 737-500 75 feet down in the Java Sea, a day after the jet with 62 people onboard lost contact with air traffic controllers following takeoff from Indonesia’s capital, officials said.
“We received reports from the diver team that …

items.title: Pompeo lifts US-Taiwan restrictions in move likely to anger China
items.author: Helen Davidson in Taipei
items.description:
Secretary of state Mike Pompeo is lifting restrictions on contacts between US officials and their Taiwanese counterparts, a move welcomed by Taiwan but labelled by some observers a publicity stunt likely designed to anger China.
The announcement came late on Saturday, just 11 days before the …

items.title: 'Now The World Gets To See The Difference': BLM Protesters On The Capitol Attack
items.author: Leila Fadel
items.description: From her couch in Minneapolis, Nuny Nichols watched a mob of largely white extremists stage an insurrection in Washington, D.C., set up a noose on a wooden beam outside the U.S. Capitol and walk a symbol of violence and slavery — the Confederate flag — through the building as they stormed and …
